FuncDef:
The attribute command configures attribute rules for the validity time, subject name, issuer name, and alternative subject name of a certificate.
The undo attribute command cancels the configuration. The attribute command configures attribute rules for the validity time, subject name, issuer name, and alternative subject name of a certificate. The undo attribute command cancels the configuration. By default, there is no limitation on the validity time, subject name, issuer name, and alternative subject name of a certificate.
CLIs: attribute <id> { alt-subject-namefqdn | { issuer-name | subject-name } dn } { ctn | equ | nctn | nequ } <attribute-value>
attribute <id> alt-subject-nameip { ctn | equ | nctn | nequ } <ip-address>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of a certificate attribute rule.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 256.

Indicates the start validity time of certificate.
The value is in the format of HH:MM:SS. HH:MM:SS indicates the hour:minute:second.
The value of HH ranges from 0 to 23; the value of MM and SS ranges from 0 to 59.

Indicates the start validity date of certificate.
The value is in the format of YYYY/MM/DD. YYYY indicates year. Its value is an integer that ranges from 2000 to 2037. MM indicates month. Its value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 12. DD indicates day. Its value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 31.

Indicates the end validity time of certificate.
The value is in the format of HH:MM:SS. HH:MM:SS indicates the hour:minute:second.
The value of HH ranges from 0 to 23; the value of MM and SS ranges from 0 to 59.

Indicates the end validity date of certificate.
The value is in the format of YYYY/MM/DD. YYYY indicates year. Its value is an integer that ranges from 2000 to 2037. MM indicates month. Its value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 12. DD indicates day. Its value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 31.

Specifies the alternative subject name of certificate.
-

Specifies the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of a PKI entity.
-

Indicates the name of certificate issuer.
-

Indicates the subject name of certificate.
-

Specifies the Distinguished Name (DN) of a PKI entity.
-

Specifies a certificate attribute value.
The value is a string of 1 to 256 case-insensitive characters.

Specifies the IP address of a PKI entity.
-

Indicates an IP address.
An IPv4 address is in dotted decimal notation, whereas an IPv6 address is in colon hexadecimal notation.

ExtraInfo: To verify the contents of a certificate, configure an attribute rule for the certificate and reference this rule in the certificate attribute-based control rule, which ensures that the certificate meeting specific conditions passes the verification.
